Issues.Title: Moving the SplitContainer splitter size at runtime crashes the DemoConsole application.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0 SDK: 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, This is the new SplitContainer integration test added to the DemoConsole application.

### Issue description

In Winforms repo, there has a [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app, the DemoConsole application crashes when moving the SplitContainer splitter size in .Net 8.0.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/feef2f95-dd97-4f11-af12-3eb88433ac91



### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo

### More Info

1. Resizing other controls or forms in the DemoConsole application also crashes.
2. Probably caused by the PR [9364](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9364)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Moving the SplitContainer splitter size at runtime crashes the DemoConsole application." (#9410)

Issues.Title: Failed to launch design tools server process process
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64 bits) - Current
Version 17.6.4

### .NET version

net 6.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

_No response_

### Issue description

I can't open forms since today. I did no update. I tried to reinstall Visual Studio Community but it did nothing.
See errors log in diagnostics

Just opening a form by double clicking on it from the projet browser and it never loads.

Issues.Title: TreeView custom sort fails if TreeNode has child nodes
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.11

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes.
Regression after PR [#9078](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9078)

### Issue description

`TreeView.TreeViewNodeSorter` instance is supposed to compare `TreeNode` objects, as described in [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.treeview.treeviewnodesorter?view=windowsdesktop-7.0):
> Gets or sets the implementation of IComparer to perform a custom sort of the TreeView nodes.

After PR #9078 TreeViewNodeSorter receives tree node text instead of the tree node itself, when sorting non-top level nodes.

Example from the [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.treeview.treeviewnodesorter?view=windowsdesktop-7.0#examples) throws `NullReferenceException`:
![nullreferenceexception_treeview_custom_sorting](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/f9d6e770-8de3-4436-9062-d28dbf9bb33b)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Install .NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.11 or older
2. Create a Windows Form App (.NET) project and copy the code from [documentation example](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.treeview.treeviewnodesorter?view=windowsdesktop-7.0#examples) or open the [sample app](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11903966/ScratchProject.zip)
3. Run the app and click "Set Sorter" button.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TreeView custom sort fails if TreeNode has child nodes" (#9394)

Issues.Title: Fixed TreeView custom sorting failure when TreeNode has child nodes
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9394


### Changes

- Fix using of `TreeViewNodeSorter.Compare` method: compare tree nodes, not nodes' `Text` values.
- Add a unit test to ensure TreeNodes are compared while sorting TreeView.

Issues.Title: The GridView's columns display incorrectly when setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to GridView and slide the scrollbar in DataGridViewColumn Collection Editor dialog
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0 SDK: 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro in .Net 6.0 and Net 7.0.

### Issue description

When setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to GridView with Columns, open DataGridViewColumn Collection Editor dialog in propertyGrid, use the mouse to slide the scrollbar left and right to observe the Columns, the GridView's columns display incorrectly.
The issue also can repro in ListView control.

**.Net 7.0/.Net 6.0**
When using the mouse to slide the scrollbar left and right, the GridView's columns display correctly.

Use following sample application:

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Narrator doesn't announce number before Hyphen/Colon while deleting number in MaskedTextBox
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8 

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

Narrator doesn't announce all of numbers in MaskedTextBox while deleting numbers in .NET 6.0, 7.0 and .NET Framework.

### Issue description

1. Narrator doesn't announce numbers before Hypen/Colon while deleting numbers in MaskedTextBox

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/130345015/dec9afe2-1dec-4659-a4b4-debebf882ea5

2. It works well in NVDA for NET 6.0, 7.0, 8.0 and Framework. NVDA announce all of numbers while deleting numbers in MaskedTextBox.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Start a Winforms .Net Core application with MaskedTextBox
2. Set Mask as Data format with Hyphen/Colon (e.g MobilePhoneNumber)
3. Run app (F5)
4. Open Narrator
5. Input 12 digits number in MaskedTextBox
6. Delete number

Issues.Title: Fix the next position is not correct when toolstrip using mouse or ke…
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9181 
Tracing the behavior described in the bug, we find that when calling the GetNextItemHorizontal() method, their input parameters are the same, which caused that, although we clicked on different buttons Left/Right, the behavior of the control is the same.
## Proposed changes

- Add a parameter with default value to GetNextItemHorizontal() method to distinguish Left/Right.
- Add a default parameter to the GetStartItem() method to return the expected ToolStripItem.
- Tweak the code so that the correct selected item is found.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- When typing Left/Right keyboard, the next focus position will be the next item, not the first item on the Left/ Right.

## Regression? 

-  No

## Risk

-

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

### .NET version

.Net 8.0 SDK: 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

When setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to ComboBox, open String Collection Editor dialog in propertyGrid, there is nothing displayed for added items in ComboBox.

Issues.Title: ToolStrip overflow menu is visible in UI Automation tree in Content View
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-preview.4.23260.5

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

ToolStrip can display some of its items in an overflow menu, when ToolStrip.Size is not big enough, or item has `ToolStripItem.Overflow` set to `Always`. This menu is opened under a 'ToolBar Options' menu item.

According to [MenuItem UIA tree structure](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/ui-automation/ui-automation-support-for-the-menuitem-control-type#required-ui-automation-tree-structure) overflow menu should be absent from UIA tree in content view:
> For the content view, Menu is absent from the UI Automation tree because it does not convey meaningful information to the end user.

**Actual result**
Menu is visible in content view:
![before](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/033735f0-12bb-430b-9623-5429d4bdc7f3)



### Steps to reproduce

Sample app: [WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11895376/WinFormsApp1.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ToolStrip overflow menu is visible in UI Automation tree in Content View" (#9384)

Issues.Title: Fix UIA tree structure for ToolStrip overflow menu
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9384


## Proposed changes

- Fix values of IsControlElementProperty and IsContentElementProperty properties in `ToolStripOverflowAccessibleObject` to support UI tree structure as described in 
[UI Automation Support for the MenuItem Control Type](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/ui-automation/ui-automation-support-for-the-menuitem-control-type#required-ui-automation-tree-structure)


<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Correct UIA tree structure

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

![before](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/115d635a-d0ec-4990-b9c0-9858c2a88f50)


### After

Menu is hidden in **content** view:

![after - content view](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/8bb004cc-5a0b-42c9-a17f-e368ec9cc6b4)

Menu is still visible in **control** view: 

![after - control view](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/c9773006-6d98-4ec6-8cdf-11fb2f7d9b39)
